  • Method Details

    • attemptAuthentication

      public org.springframework.security.core.Authentication attemptAuthentication​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException
      When a user tries to login, this method will be called. It will try to login a with the given credentials, and if the credentials are valid, the #successfullAuthentication method is called
      Overrides:
      attemptAuthentication in class org.springframework.security.web.authentication.UsernamePasswordAuthenticationFilter
      Parameters:
      request - http request
      response - http response
      Returns:
      Authentication
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException - if the login there is an error with the login attemt or the given credentials were invalid

    • successfulAuthentication

      protected void successfulAuthentication​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response, javax.servlet.FilterChain chain, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authResult) throws java.io.IOException, javax.servlet.ServletException
      If an authentication attempts is successful, this method is called. In other words, we have a user, and we must now generate them an access token they can use to make authentication requests.
      Overrides:
      successfulAuthentication in class org.springframework.security.web.authentication.AbstractAuthenticationProcessingFilter
      Parameters:
      request - http request
      response - http response
      chain - filter chain
      authResult - result of authentication
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if
      javax.servlet.ServletException
